diagnosis.final_diagnosis: gallstone pancreatitis, acute cholecystitis, cholelithiasis, choledocholithiasis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with diffuse abdominal, back, and chest discomfort, associated with rising liver function tests (LFTs) and imaging showing choledocholithiasis, obstructing stones in the common bile duct, and acute cholecystitis characterized by a distended gallbladder and surrounding fluid. The imaging findings and clinical symptoms supported the diagnosis.
